src.paillier.crypto
Class PaillierKey

java.lang.Object
  src.paillier.crypto.PaillierKey
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Key
Direct Known Subclasses:
PaillierPrivateKey, PaillierPublicKey
public class PaillierKey
extends Object
implements Key

The Key interface is the top-level interface for all keys. An Algorithm - This is the key algorithm for that key - Paillier. An Encoded Form - This is an external encoded form for the key,the Paillier key does not supported encoded according to a standard format. The public and private key classes both descend from PaillierKey, which is simply a container for n and nsquare used in both classes PaillierPublicKey and PaillierPrivateKey.

Version:
12-03-13
Author:
Peter Stefanov - NUIMaynooth
See Also:

Method Detail

generateRandomRinZn

public BigInteger generateRandomRinZn(BigInteger n,
                                      SecureRandom SECURE_RANDOM)
This method generates a random r in Z_{n}^* for each separate encryption using the same modulus n Paillier cryptosystem allows the generated r to differ every time, such that the same plaintext encrypted several times will produce different ciphertext every time. This method is called from PaillierHomomorphicCipher.encrypt or PaillierCipher.encrypt.

Parameters:
n - -BigInteger
SECURE_RANDOM -
Returns:
r -BigInteger

toString

public String toString()
Returns the modulus n and r separate by commas represent in String format. This method should be removed,its used only for E Voting - Paillier Application . Instead should be implemented KeyStore, KeyPairGeneratorSpec, ... In order to get n, for or is not recomended to have access to it.

Overrides:
